topics.title: Identity Development
topics.description: Exploring personal values, beliefs, and identity formation during adolescence

parts.focusArea: Understanding Identity: What Shapes Who You Are

topics.title: Being Healthy
topics.description: Understanding health behaviours including nutrition, physical activity, sleep, and substance awareness

parts.description: Dimensions of health (physical, social, emotional, mental, spiritual); holistic wellbeing; Aboriginal perspectives on health; factors influencing health
Australian Guide to Healthy Eating; food groups; discretionary foods; evaluating nutrition information; media influence on food choices
Australian 24-Hour Movement Guidelines; types of physical activity; fitness components; benefits of regular activity; reducing sedentary behaviour
Sleep requirements for adolescents; sleep hygiene; screen time and sleep; rest and recovery for wellbeing; managing fatigue
Alcohol, tobacco, e-cigarettes, and other substances; short and long-term effects; influences on substance use; refusal strategies; help-seeking

topics.title: Mental Health and Wellbeing
topics.description: Understanding, promoting, and supporting mental health and emotional wellbeing

parts.description: What is mental health; mental health continuum; common mental health challenges in adolescence; stigma reduction
Identifying and understanding emotions; factors influencing emotional responses; strategies for managing emotions
What is resilience; protective factors; coping strategies; growth mindset; bouncing back from challenges
Understanding stress; sources of stress for adolescents; physical and emotional effects; stress management strategies
When and how to seek help; trusted adults and support services; supporting friends; being an upstander

topics.title: Respectful Relationships
topics.description: Developing skills for healthy, respectful relationships and understanding consent
topics.subStrand: Communicating and interacting for health and wellbeing

parts.description: Characteristics of respectful relationships; respect, trust, and honesty; different types of relationships
Assertive communication; active listening; expressing needs and boundaries; conflict resolution
What is consent; seeking, giving, and denying consent; consent in different contexts; recognising when consent is absent
Gender stereotypes; power in relationships; recognising unhealthy relationship dynamics; challenging harmful norms
Online communication; cyberbullying; image-based abuse; protecting yourself online; reporting and help-seeking

topics.title: Safety and Risk Management
topics.description: Developing protective behaviours and skills to manage risks and stay safe
topics.subStrand: Contributing to healthy and active communities

parts.description: What is risk; risk versus harm; factors influencing risk-taking; protective factors
Recognising unsafe situations; early warning signs; safety strategies; trusted adults and networks
DRSABCD; basic first aid principles; calling for help; responding to common emergencies
Pedestrian safety; cycling safety; passenger safety; public transport; planning safe travel
Water safety awareness; swimming and aquatic environments; sun protection; skin cancer prevention

subStrands: Communicating and interacting for health and wellbeing
Contributing to healthy and active communities

contentDescriptors.VC2HP8P01: Analyse and reflect on the influence of values and beliefs on the development of identities
contentDescriptors.VC2HP8P02: Analyse the impact of changes and transitions, and devise strategies to support themselves and others through these changes
contentDescriptors.VC2HP8P03: Examine how roles, decision-making, and levels of power, coercion and control within relationships can be influenced by gender stereotypes
contentDescriptors.VC2HP8P04: Examine the roles of respect, empathy, power and coercion in developing respectful relationships
contentDescriptors.VC2HP8P05: Investigate strategies that influence how communities value diversity and propose actions they can take to promote inclusion in their communities
contentDescriptors.VC2HP8P06: Analyse factors that influence emotional responses and devise strategies to self-manage emotions
contentDescriptors.VC2HP8P07: Explain and apply skills and strategies to communicate assertively and respectfully when seeking, giving or denying consent across multiple settings
contentDescriptors.VC2HP8P08: Refine protective behaviours and evaluate community resources to seek help for themselves and others
contentDescriptors.VC2HP8P09: Investigate how media and influential people in the community impact attitudes, beliefs, decisions and behaviours in relation to health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
contentDescriptors.VC2HP8P10: Plan and implement strategies, using health resources, to enhance their own and others' health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
